meanings.definition: To make or become faster or more active.
meanings.sent1: Running can quicken your pace during a race.
meanings.sent2: The caffeine in coffee can help quicken your heartbeat.
meanings.sent3: The news of a snow day quickened the students' steps to school.
meanings.sent4: Her encouraging words quickened his determination to finish the project.
meanings.sent5: The urgent call for help quickened their response time.

meanings.sent1: The surprise party quickened her spirits.
meanings.sent2: The thrilling movie quickened his pulse.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks never fail to quicken the audience's interest.
meanings.sent4: The vibrant colors of the painting quickened her imagination.
meanings.sent5: The lively music quickened the dancers' movements.

meanings.definition: To come to life or become alive.
meanings.sent1: The garden quickened with the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent2: The newborn baby quickened the family's joy.
meanings.sent3: The old clock seemed to quicken its ticking when wound up.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays quickened the sleepy town to start their day.
meanings.sent5: The first notes of the symphony quickened the audience's anticipation.
